subject: Re: [junit] A case for adding logging of assertions to junit

messageBody:
On 2008-06-09, at 22:16 , CÃ©dric Beust ? wrote:

> On Mon, Jun 9, 2008 at 5:39 PM, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...
> > wrote:
> > I believe that if JUnit logged its assertions, then
> > that would have robbed me of this experience.
>
> That's quite puzzling. I can't see how the existence of this feature
> could ever prevent a developer from writing tests.
>
Neither can I. I didn't write that. I wrote this:

"I understand that. I have also felt this need in the past. When I
observed that I could solve many of the same problems by writing
smaller, more focused tests, not only did I stop wanting to log
assertions, but my designs improved and I delivered more solid
features sooner. I believe that if JUnit logged its assertions, then
that would have robbed me of this experience."

If JUnit logged its assertions, then I likely would have just logged
assertions when I wanted to, rather than learning the vital lessons of
writing better tests.
> Again, these are
> very orthogonal issues: one is about testing your software, the other
> is about improving the reports.
>
No. Again, these are related issues: if I can't log assertions, then I
have to write better tests.
